fact: Operation Battleaxe (June 1941) was supported by RAF and RAAF squadrons of 253 Wing
source_citation: RAF Museum - 1941 Timeline, Operation Battleaxe entry
notes: 253 Wing coordinated RAF/RAAF squadrons in Western Desert June 1941

fact: 253 Wing included two squadrons of Hawker Hurricanes in June 1941
notes: Primary RAF single-engine fighter in North Africa Q2 1941

fact: 253 Wing included one squadron of Bristol Blenheims in June 1941
253 Wing included one squadron of Curtiss Tomahawks in June 1941
South African Air Force committed one squadron of Hurricanes for Operation Battleaxe
notes: Commonwealth contribution per user's CLAUDE.md instructions

fact: South African Air Force committed one Squadron of Martin Marylands for Operation Battleaxe
No.11 Squadron (Bristol Blenheims) reinforced RAF contingent in Greece, then returned to Middle East
notes: Squadron active in Middle East theater 1941

fact: No.113 Squadron (Bristol Blenheims) reinforced RAF contingent in Greece, then returned to Middle East
notes: Squadron active in Middle East theater 1941

fact: No.33 Squadron (Hawker Hurricanes) reinforced RAF contingent in Greece, then returned to Middle East
notes: Squadron active in Middle East theater 1941

fact: No.208 Squadron (Westland Lysanders) reinforced RAF contingent in Greece, then returned to Middle East
No.148 Squadron (Wellington bombers) was recalled to the Middle East on 9 March 1941
Operation Crusader (November 1941) had sixteen squadrons of fighters including Hawker Hurricanes, Curtiss Tomahawks and Bristol Beaufighters
notes: Shows growth from Q2 to Q4 1941

fact: Operation Crusader had eight squadrons of bombers including Bristol Blenheims and Martin Marylands
Operation Crusader had three tactical reconnaissance squadrons with Hurricanes and Douglas Bostons
RAF Middle East Command was the overall theater command for North Africa operations
